body: @Ncoder1 do you still have a session that reproduces the issue? Tried some alert fuzzing but no luck reproducing it.

@thc202 , sorry i didnt get an update regarding the question !
Yes i do have a session (but unfortunately, i might not be able to share it :( But i can help you with any info you want.
But when i opened and tried to run the report through the tabs, i get the same error; Full logs from the time i opened the session

(Sorry for not commenting sooner, this is on my TODO list of things to be done for 2.6.0)

No updates yet, not enough info to address the issue. Do you still have access to the session that exhibits the issue? If so, are you able to run a Stand Alone script? I might provide a script to pinpoint the issue more easily.
@thc202, Yes i do have access now. I have got the issue for a different application. i can run a standalone script, please send me the script.

@thc202 , I have found the root cause of the issue, Base 64 Disclosure does not stop detecting its instances and the count keeps increasing. So when i try to generate the report its failing. This could be possible for all passive scan vulnerabilities that could keep findings issues and does not stop. I disabled Base 64 Disclosure in Options --> Passive Scan Rules and then i was able to generate the report.
@thc202 , I faced this issue for active scan(ZAP version 2.6.0).

@devQA123 are you seeing the same error in the zap.log?

@Ncoder1 thanks for the info, will try reproduce that with the steps provided.

@thc202 , Yes.
